flawed_nl_solution:
His utilities cost 1/2 the amount of his $250 car payment so his utilities cost 250/2 = $<<250/2=125>>125
All total, his bills cost him 775+250+125+50 = $<<775+250+125+50=1202>>1202
He makes $2500 a month and his bills cost $1202 a month so that leaves him with 2500-1202 = $<<2500-1202=1298>>1298
He wants to put half of $1298 into a retirement account so he will invest 1298/2= $<<1298/2=649>>649 into his retirement account
He had 1298 and puts $649 into his retirement account so that leaves him with 1298-649 = $<<1298-649=649>>649 remaining
#### 649

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1200, not 1202. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
